C

Client - Class in fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.components
The class Client implements a component that calls the asynchronous calculator component to show how it works.
Client() - Constructor for class fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.components.Client
create a client component with two threads (one to execute the test scenario and one to receive asynchronously the results of the computations).
Client(String) - Constructor for class fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.components.Client
create a client component with two threads (one to execute the test scenario and one to receive asynchronously the results of the computations) and the given URI of the reflection inbound port.
convertToArray(Object) - Method in class fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asynvcacl.components.VectorClient
converting an object to an object array, provided that the object is effectively an array.
convertToString(Object[]) - Method in class fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asynvcacl.components.VectorClient
converting an object array to a string.
createPort() - Method in class fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.components.AsynchronousCalculator
create the inbound port of the component offering the component interface AsynchronousCalculatorServicesCI; the use of a method to create this port allows to change the component interface and the port to ones that are extending the current interface and port by simply redefining this method in a subclass.
createPort() - Method in class fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asynpcalc.components.AsynchronousParallelCalculator
 
createPort() - Method in class fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asynvcacl.components.AsynchronousVectorCalculator
